title: Vintage Radio Dial Font
content:
Here is a vintage radio dial I am remaking, I am having a hard time finding this font, can anyone help????

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [rca\_m45-a\_dial\_glass\_sm.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020201842/http:/typophile.com/files/rca_m45-a_dial_glass_sm.jpg) | 31.06 KB |
| [M45 Front View.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020201842/http:/typophile.com/files/M45%20Front%20View.jpg) | 438.86 KB |
author: pregnantembryo

comments.content: It is probable that the numerals were drafted from scratch by the product designers, like most manufactured devices before a certain time.

I second Kevin's point. OTOH, in a similar vein in one way, and completely different in another…  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/architectuur-nf/regular/glyphs.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020201842/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/architectuur-nf/regular/glyphs.html "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/architectuur-nf/regular/glyphs.html")

You might find something similar here:  
 [http://www.fontbros.com/selectronic/retro-1936-1965](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020201842/http:/www.fontbros.com/selectronic/retro-1936-1965 "http://www.fontbros.com/selectronic/retro-1936-1965")
Thank you so much! Freezer looks good...
